item.title: Empty shelves, for-lease signs and job layoffs point to recession by summer
item.description: Stop the trade flow and you stop the economy — as Americans are about to learn.

item.title: Jobless claims fall in latest week, with no sign of recession or layoffs
item.description: Companies are holding on to workers, despite uncertainty over trade policy and the contraction in first-quarter GDP.

item.title: Burger King parent saw slower start to the year as revenue and earnings miss marks
item.description: Restaurant Brands is the latest fast-food giant to cite weak first quarter demand.

item.title: Markets are resilient — but this bank says it could fall apart quickly. ‘Fundamentals remain dire.’
item.description: HSBC is warning clients that the odds are stacked against resilience for markets staying intact.
